intro: Triticum repens var. tenerum, commonly known as soft wheatgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions. It is characterized by its fine, tender leaves and compact growth habit, making it suitable for ornamental and grazing purposes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, greenish flowers in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its high nutritional value, it is also used in livestock feed and traditional herbal remedies.
